title: Drones Embody an Iran-Russia Alliance Built on Hostility to the U.S.
description: Authoritarian regimes in Moscow and Tehran have in common international isolation, domestic crisis and conflict with the West.

title: Russia Unleashes More Drones on Kyiv, Sowing Fear and Bringing Death
description: “What a horror,” said a Ukrainian retiree, as plumes of smoke rose from a central Kyiv street. “Again!” she said. “This is now happening all the time.”

title: China Recruiting Former R.A.F. Pilots to Train Army Pilots., U.K. Says
description: Citing national security, Britain wants to stop its retired military pilots from accepting lucrative contracts to train members of the People’s Liberation Army.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Kyiv is Attacked by Iranian-Made Drones
description: Plus China delays economic data and the U.K. finance minister drops the tax plan.

title: A Military Jet Crashed in Southern Russia, Killing At Least Four
description: Russian military officials said the jet was on a training flight when one of its engines caught fire, causing it to crash in a port town about 25 miles from Ukraine.

title: Rightist Party in Sweden Gets No Formal Role but Big Say in Government
description: The anti-immigrant Sweden Democrats will have a say over new policies for the incoming government under a complicated leadership agreement.

title: Nigeria Floods Kill Hundreds and Displace Over a Million
description: The country is experiencing its worst floods in years, largely because of heavy rains caused by climate change.

title: Resilient Kyiv Patches Up After Attacks, but Some Things Can’t Be Fixed
description: After a barrage of Russian missile and drone strikes on the Ukrainian capital, its residents show a resolve to clean up and press on.

title: Crude Comments From Europe’s Top Diplomat Point to Bigger Problems
description: Josep Borrell Fontelles said Europe was “a garden,” and the world “a jungle,” triggering charges of neocolonialism and racism just as the E.U. tries to drum up support in the developing world.

title: ‘Done on the Sly’: France’s Flawed Return of Skulls to Algeria
description: The restitution of the remains, said to belong to 19th-century freedom fighters, was hailed as a symbol of reconciliation, but papers obtained by The Times reveal a gesture muddled by politics.

title: Mayor Says Moscow Has Reached Its Draft Quota
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia announced what he called a partial mobilization of troops on Sep. 21. Defense officials had said Russia would aim to draft about 300,000 civilians.

title: Protester Is Dragged Into a Chinese Consulate in England and Beaten
description: The scuffle came as tensions have escalated between Beijing and London, which has offered special visas to Hong Kongers seeking to leave.

title: BTS to Enlist in South Korea’s Military
description: Ending months of debate, the band’s label said that the seven members would serve their military conscriptions. They plan to reunite in a couple of years.

title: Here’s what we know about the attacks on Kyiv.
Generators Switch Back On at Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant After Russian Strike
description: A Russian strike again disconnected the embattled plant from the national power grid, forcing it to move to backup power, officials said.

title: What We Know About the Iranian-Made Drones Russia Is Using in Ukraine
description: Russia has used the drones to strike on the battlefield and in Ukrainian cities. Their use may be a sign that Moscow is running low on precision-guided weapons.

title: At least two drones appeared to target a city heating station in central Kyiv.
Ukraine Live Updates: Kyiv Rocked by Explosions From ‘Kamikaze’ Drones
description: At least three people were killed in the attacks, which appeared to be some of the most significant since Russian forces began a retaliation campaign targeting civilians across Ukraine one week ago.

title: New U.K. Finance Minister Pulls Back Further on Fiscal Plan
description: Jeremy Hunt, the new chancellor of the Exchequer, announced a sweeping reversal in an effort to steady the markets and reduce the pressure on Prime Minister Liz Truss.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Comeback
description: Republican leaders have embraced the former political pariah, demonstrating Trumpism’s hold over the party.

title: In Xi’s China, the Business of Business Is State-Controlled
description: The Chinese leader has increasingly demanded that businesses conform to the aims of the Communist Party, an agenda he doubled down on this week at an important political gathering.

title: Is This the World’s Most Picturesque High Dive?
description: Catch a glimpse of a storied tradition in Bosnia and Herzegovina, where, for hundreds of years, divers have leaped from a bridge in the southern city of Mostar.

title: A week after a round of strikes, Kyiv’s people take cover again.
Your Monday Briefing
description: Troubles with Russia’s draft.

title: Iran’s Loyal Security Forces Protect Ruling System That Protesters Want to Topple
description: The Revolutionary Guards — the country’s most powerful military force — have become so deeply woven into Iran’s economy and power structure that they have everything to lose if the system falls.
